summary: Completed comprehensive backend testing of call outcome tracking and recording features. All new recording functionality, database models, API endpoints, and integration points are working correctly. The recording proxy system, token generation, webhook event handling, and batch summary features are fully operational.
passed_tests: CallRecording model exists with all required fields: call_id, user_id, batch_id, retell_url, file_path, token, downloaded, created_at
CallLogsTable has recording_requested (BooleanField) and recording_fee (DecimalField) fields implemented
Recording proxy endpoint GET /api/recordings/<token>/ returns 404 for invalid tokens as expected
Batch recordings page GET /api/recordings/batch/<token>/ returns 404 for invalid tokens (no recordings found)
Retell webhook /api/webhook/retell handles call_started events correctly
Retell webhook /api/webhook/retell handles call_ended events with recording URLs correctly
Retell webhook /api/webhook/retell handles call_analyzed events correctly
Retell webhook /api/webhook/retell handles transcript_updated events correctly
Recording token generation format verified (token structure: sig_callid_userid)
send_call_through_pathway function accepts recording_requested parameter and stores in CallLogsTable with $0.02 fee
bulk_ivr_flow function accepts recording_requested parameter and stores in both BatchCallLogs and CallLogsTable
All existing API endpoints still work: /api/telegram/webhook/, /api/dtmf/supervisor-check, /api/webhook/sms, /api/time-check
Recording features configuration verified: RETELL_API_KEY, webhook_url, media/recordings directory exists
Database models correctly structured and accessible via Django ORM
Call outcome summary webhook processing working for both individual and batch calls
DTMF extraction from transcript_object working in webhook handlers
Recording URL proxy system configured for secure access via generated tokens
success_percentage: Backend: 100% (13/13 recording feature tests passed, all models and endpoints verified)
